Level 3 maths and English

Level 3 maths and English payment breakdown on a 1 year programme
Level 3 maths and English payment

to deliver maths and/or English alongside level 3 qualifications to students without maths and/or English GCSE grade 9 to 4 (or equivalent) at the start of their level 3 programme

Where proportion of students comes from

Proportion of students is calculated using 2019 to 2020 student home postcodes from the autumn census 2020 and the index of multiple deprivation 2019.

Total low prior attainment in maths or English £311,651
Where average instances come from

Average instances are calculated using 2019 to 2020 data from the autumn census 2020. A student gets one instance of funding if they do not have grade 4, C or higher in GCSE maths or English. Those without both GCSEs get 2 instances of funding.

Details are in your allocation calculation toolkit.

Where funded students 2019 to 2020 come from

If you have 1 to 10 eligible students, we will fund you for 10 students. If you have 11 to 20 eligible students, we will fund you for 20 students.

High needs £186,000

£186,000
Total high needs breakdown
High needs Places Rate Sub-total
16 to 19 students
Places: 29
Rate: £6,000 		29 £6,000 £174,000
19 to 24 students
Places: 2
Rate: £6,000 		2 £6,000 £12,000
Total high needs
Places: 31 		31 £186,000
Where places comes from

Places are either rolled forward from 2020 to 2021 or your local authority agreed it with ESFA. This provides a base level of funding.

You must agree additional funding above this level with your local authority. Local authorities pay you the top-up funding directly. It is not shown in this statement.

Free meals adjustment £0
Discretionary bursary fund 2021 to 2022 £206,411
Where average instances come from

Average instances are calculated using 2019 to 2020 data from the autumn census 2020 and the index of multiple deprivation 2019. Students are given an instance value for each funding element that is then averaged across total funded students.

Details are in your allocation calculation toolkit.

Adjusted discretionary bursary fund 2021 to 2022

From 2020 to 2021, the ESFA moved to a new methodology to calculate this fund. During the transition, you will receive between 50% and 150% of the amount you received in 2019 to 2020.
